Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission announced the approval of the resolution of a nationwide disability discrimination case against home improvement retailer Lowe's. A U.S. District Court Judge approved the consent decree which called for the distribution of $8.6 million.
Info Source: https://www.eeoc.gov/eeoc/newsroom/release/5-13-16.cfm
Notes: Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.

Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case

Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: Lowes' Home Centers, one of the nation's largest home improvement retailers, has agreed to implement a comprehensive, corporate-wide compliance program at its more than 1,700 stores nationwide to ensure its contractors minimize lead dust from home renovation activities, as required by the federal Lead Renovation, Repair and Painting (RRP) Rule, the Department of Justice and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced. The company will also pay a $500,000 civil penalty, which is the largest ever for violations of the RRP Rule.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/corporate-wide-settlement-lowe-s-protects-public-lead-pollution-during-home-renovations
